definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: You reject positive experiences by insisting they don’t count.
sentences.chinese: 你拒不接受積極的體驗，堅持把他們排斥在外。

sentences.english: He pursued her relentlessly, refusing to take 'no' for an answer.
sentences.chinese: 他鍥而不捨地追求她，拒不接受“不”的回答。

sentences.english: I refuse, however favourable the conditions.
sentences.chinese: 不論條件如何優惠，我都拒不接受。

definition: to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to order/to enjoin/to charge/to instruct sb to finish sth
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property
refusing to listen to advice or remonstrance/incorrigible
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
